title: Unclear "cannot infer" error message instead of expected "cannot move out of borrowed content"

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The error message for the following code is very unclear:

```rust
struct Parser<'a> {
    buf: &'a mut Vec<u8>,
}

impl<'a> Parser<'a> {
    fn parse(&mut self) -> Option<Packet<'a>> {
        Some(Packet {
            buf: self.buf,
        })
    }
}

struct Packet<'a> {
    buf: &'a mut Vec<u8>,
}
```

```
error[E0495]: cannot infer an appropriate lifetime for lifetime parameter `'a` due to conflicting requirements
 --> src/main.rs:9:14
  |
9 |         Some(Packet {
  |              ^^^^^^
  |
note: first, the lifetime cannot outlive the anonymous lifetime #1 defined on the method body at 8:5...
 --> src/main.rs:8:5
  |
8 | /     fn parse(&mut self) -> Option<Packet<'a>> {
9 | |         Some(Packet {
10| |             buf: self.buf,
11| |         })
12| |     }
  | |_____^
note: ...so that reference does not outlive borrowed content
 --> src/main.rs:10:18
  |
10|             buf: self.buf,
  |                  ^^^^^^^^
note: but, the lifetime must be valid for the lifetime 'a as defined on the impl at 7:1...
 --> src/main.rs:7:1
  |
7 | impl<'a> Parser<'a> {
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  = note: ...so that the expression is assignable:
          expected std::option::Option<Packet<'a>>
             found std::option::Option<Packet<'_>>
```

The mentioned conflict does not seem to make sense, since it's just moving `&'a mut T` to a place that expects a `&'a mut T`. The actual problem is that `self.buf` cannot be moved out of the mutable reference to `self`. The error message looks a lot better when moving `self.buf` into a local variable like this:

```rust
    fn parse(&mut self) -> Option<Packet<'a>> {
        let buf = self.buf;
        Some(Packet {
            buf,
        })
    }
```

```
error[E0507]: cannot move out of borrowed content
 --> src/main.rs:9:19
  |
9 |         let buf = self.buf;
  |                   ^^^^----
  |                   |
  |                   cannot move out of borrowed content
  |                   help: consider using a reference instead: `&self.buf`
```

(the actual fix was wrapping the `buf` field in an `Option` and `take`ing it out when constructing the `Packet`)

With `#![feature(nll)]`, the error message for the original code looks different, but still roughly as bad:
```
error: free region `` does not outlive free region `'a`
  --> src/main.rs:9:14
   |
9  |           Some(Packet {
   |  ______________^
10 | |             buf: self.buf,
11 | |         })
   | |_________^
```
